results.title: Our federal constitutional system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
According to Dr. Ivan Hinderaker, the founders of the United States of America questioned whether they should control it. He explains how the American Constitution and the Bill of Rights came about, and claim that there are three main classifications of government: Dictatorship or Democracy? Unitary or Federal? Parliamentary or Presidential? Good use of graphics as an educational tool.

results.title: The Meaning of democracy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr. E E Schattschneider explains the meaning of democracy. Democracy, in his view, is a way of living justly with other people. It is a search for justice and truth. The American Bill of Rights and the system of justice are also discussed.

results.title: Pressure groups in action
results.creator_credit: Marbury Ogle, Republic Steel Corporation and Cinecraft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr Marbury Ogle says that man has always organised groups to help him achieve what was beyond the capacity of one person. In America there are at least 300,000 formal and informal pressure groups, which try to direct, educate and motivate members, to win over the general public and to try to influence the government by lobbying. The lobbyist may act as a valuable informal consultant to a politician while his group may give minorities a chance to express their needs.

group_works.title: The Role of the Supreme Court

results.title: The Role of the Supreme Court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr David Fellman claims that the U.S. Supreme Court is unique because of its great power. The American system of government is based on the constitution and the Supreme Court is its final judge and arbiter. Dr Fellman discusses the role, organisation, jurisdiction procedures of the supreme court, and explains how it fits in with other U.S. Governmental and civil institutions

results.title: Buffy. Season 2. Part 2. Eps 13-22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season two of Joss Whedon’s cult series saw the introduction of Vampires Spike (James Masterson) and Drusilla (Juliet Landau) (Ep. 3 School hard), this seasons resident ‘big-bads’. This was the year that Buffy the Vampire slayer’s popularity went from small cult following to full blown media event, gaining some of the highest ratings the show has ever had in the US. Season two also saw the introduction of the cool and mysterious Oz (Seth Green), who became a ‘Scooby gang’ regular and a potential love interest for Willow. Unfortunately, like everything else in Sunnydale High, gateway to the hellmouth, Oz has teen issues of the supernatural kind (Ep. 15, Phases). Love is also in the air for Zander (Nicholas Brendan) as he hooks up with the ‘cliquey’ Cordelia (Charisma Carpenter), an unlikely pairing which results in much bitchy repartee (Ep. 10, What’s my line, Part two). Aside from a new slayer unexpectedly arriving on the scene (Ep. 9, What’s my line, Part One), season two’s biggest surprise ended up being the transformation of Buffy’s `soulful’ boyfriend Angel (David Boreanaz) into the uber evil, Angelus (Ep. 13, Surprise and Ep. 14, Innocence). This causes the love struck Buffy much grief as she has to make some difficult and painful decisions (Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Meanwhile, Angelus makes it his personal mission to make the slayer’s life hell (Ep. 17, Passion), while joining forces with Spike and Drusilla as they attempt to awaken a demon that will suck the world into hell (Ep. 21, Becoming, Part one and Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Cast includes: Sarah Michele Gellar, Alyson Hannigan, Nicholas Brendan, Anthony Stewart Head.

results.title: Buffy. Season 5. Part 2. Eps 12-22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Buffy season five opens with a deceptively playful episode, (Eps. 79 Buffy Vs. Dracula), where the slayer comes face to face with the celebrated count. Full of the expected smart one-liners and folkloric reinvention, the episode serves to reveal the running thread through this season - what is the full extent and meaning of Buffy’s slayer power? Without a doubt season five is the darkest of the lot but also sees creator Joss Whedon’s writing team at their most ingenious. A case in point, this is the season that Buffy’s little sister Dawn (Michelle Trachtenberg) is revealed (Eps. 79 Buffy Vs. Dracula and Eps. 80 Real me). What role this new addition to the Buffy universe has becomes one of the more inspired inventions that the writers have dreamed up. Also set up in season five is Spike’s unsettling growing attraction to his object of hate, Buffy. (Eps. 82 Out of my mind). This plot strand is a perfect example how ideas are initially set up by Whedon and crew to have long term ramifications for the season and in this case for the entire series. This season’s villain turns out to be the high priestess of insanity, Glory played with exuberant glee by Clare Kramer( Eps. 83 No place like home). What Glory actually is simply goes down as one of the most breathtaking revelations in the series (Eps. 90 Checkpoint). Glory also proves to be quite literally an indestructible foe, lending the season a prevailing sense of fatalism that is ultimately realised in one unforgettable episode, The Body (Eps. 94 The Body). Cast includes: Sarah Michelle Gellar, Nicholas Brendon, Alyson Hannigan, James Marsters, Mark Blucas, Amber Benson, Anthony Stewart Head, Kristine Sutherland, Emma Caulfield.

results.title: Buffy. Season 3. Part 1. Eps 23-33 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season three of Joss Whedon’s “Buffy the vampire slayer” saw the show at the height of its fan base and ratings popularity. All over the globe Buffy (Sarah Michelle Gellar) had entered into the consciousness of popular culture. Season two ended with Buffy running away from Sunnydale after having to kill her one true love Angel (David Boreanaz) who had turned into the evil Angelus. Complicating matters further was Buffy’s mother Joyce (Kristine Sutherland) who discovered that her teenage daughter was a vampire slayer. Season three opens on a Sunnydale, minus Buffy which is proving a burden for the rest of the Scooby gang whose vampire skills aren’t on the same level as the slayer (Eps. one, Annie). Buffy eventually returns to Sunnydale to find a new slayer in town, the rough and impulsive Faith (Eps. three, Faith, hope and trick). Each season creator Joss Whedon and his team of writers face the challenge of providing fresh and inventive adversaries for Buffy and her gang to fight. In season three they rise to the challenge with the introduction of the Mayor (Harry Groener), a villain whose unnerving chirpy demure hilariously clashes with his plans for world domination and the destruction of Sunnydale as we know it. With season three Whedon played up even more the hormonal havoc his teenage leads have to contend with, as Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Xander (Nicholas Brendon) overstep the line in their friendship and a potential new romance for Buffy is thwarted by the shock return of Angel (Eps. four, Beauty and the beasts). Other highlights include the introduction of Anya (Eps. nine, The wish), a vengeance demon that grants Cordelia’s wish of a Sunnydale without Buffy and the exciting two part finale (Eps. twenty one and twenty two, Graduation day) where the Mayor’s apocalyptic ‘ascension’ comes to fruition. Cast includes: Seth Green, Charisma Carpenter, Anthony Stuart Head, Eliza Dushku, James Marsters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

Season three opens on a Sunnydale, minus Buffy which is proving a burden for the rest of the Scooby gang whose vampire skills aren’t on the same level as the slayer (Eps. one, Annie). Buffy eventually returns to Sunnydale to find a new slayer in town, the rough and impulsive Faith (Eps. three, Faith, hope and trick). Each season creator Joss Whedon and his team of writers face the challenge of providing fresh and inventive adversaries for Buffy and her gang to fight. In season three they rise to the challenge with the introduction of the Mayor (Harry Groener), a villain whose unnerving chirpy demure hilariously clashes with his plans for world domination and the destruction of Sunnydale as we know it. With season three Whedon played up even more the hormonal havoc his teenage leads have to contend with, as Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Xander (Nicholas Brendon) overstep the line in their friendship and a potential new romance for Buffy is thwarted by the shock return of Angel (Eps. four, Beauty and the beasts). Other highlights include the introduction of Anya (Eps. nine, The wish), a vengeance demon that grants Cordelia’s wish of a Sunnydale without Buffy and the exciting two part finale (Eps. twenty one and twenty two, Graduation day) where the Mayor’s apocalyptic ‘ascension’ comes to fruition. Cast includes: Seth Green, Charisma Carpenter, Anthony Stuart Head, Eliza Dushku, James Marsters.

results.title: Buffy. Season 4. Part 1. Eps 45-55
results.creator_credit: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season four of Buffy the vampire slayer saw the ‘scooby’ gang heading off to university (except for Xander who faced a year of unemployment and low paid jobs). Naturally with this new environment the dynamics change. No longer is Buffy the master of her own destiny as she discovers in the opening episode (ep, 45 The Freshman). In fact, university life proves to be a difficult adjustment for the slayer as a band of campus vampires target the fragile Buffy and she misjudges the intentions of the campus lothario. Meanwhile, Willow (Alyson Hannigan) has come into her own. University proves to be an exciting challenge for the trainee wicca and the beginning of a new relationship with fellow campus witch, Tara (Amber Benson). There are some welcome returns (and not so welcome) to Sunnydale, notably Anya (Emma Caulfield), an ex-vengeance demon who decides to romantically pursue Xander. The other returning character is the indestructible vampire Spike (James Marsters) who returns with a new girlfriend in tow, the flaky Harmony (ep. 47 The Harsh light of day). The big season arc turns out to be the revelation that Sunnydale college also contains a secret initiative set up by the government to combat the demon problem (ep. 51 The Initiative). Buffy unwittingly becomes involved with the covert group when she falls for one of its soldiers, Riley Finn (Marc Blucas). Midway into the season the ‘big bad’ is revealed as being an ‘initiative’ experiment gone wrong, Adam (shades of Frankenstein echo throughout the season). Considered one of the more difficult years by fans, Whedon and his band of writers fashioned a more mature season that saw the gang entering into more emotionally complex terrain, as the realities of college life and adulthood threatened to split their friendships apart. The season curiously ended with a stand alone episode which hinted at difficult times ahead for the slayer. (ep. 66 Restless). Cast includes: Anthony Stewart Head, Eliza Dushku, Nicholas Brendon, Lindsay Crouse, Kristine Sutherland, Seth Green, David Boreanaz.
